alert.note: Alert for East Central Plains; Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains; Sandia Manzano And Gallinas Mountains; West Central Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 03 at 2:05PM MST until March 04 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING LATE FRIDAY MORNING THROUGH EARLY EVENING ACROSS THE WEST CENTRAL HIGHLANDS, MIDDLE RIO GRANDE VALLEY, NORTHEAST HIGHLANDS, SANDIA/MANZANO AND GALLINAS MOUNTAINS, AND EASTERN PLAINS BELOW SIGNIFICANT SNOWPACK DUE TO STRONG WIND AND LOW HUMIDITY... .An upper level disturbance will bring strong southwest winds aloft into New Mexico on Friday. Through the afternoon, these strong winds will mix down to the surface with gusty conditions expected over much of southwestern, central, and eastern New Mexico. In addition, above average warmth will remain in place with dry conditions, low humidity, and an unstable atmosphere. This will lead to several hours of critical fire weather. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 8 PM MST FRIDAY... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from 11 AM to 8 PM MST Friday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AREA AND TIMING...West Central Highlands, Middle Rio Grande Valley, Northeast Highlands, Sandia/Manzano and Gallinas Mountains, and Eastern Plains below significant snowpack Friday from late morning through early evening. The most critical conditions will occur during mid to late afternoon when winds will be the strongest. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest 20 to 30 mph with occasional gusts of 40 to 50 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Dropping between 9 to 15 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.

area.areaDesc: East Central Plains; Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains; Sandia Manzano And Gallinas Mountains; West Central Highlands
